translated: The Group of Discourses with Twos🔽The Chapter on Sandals
“Though I am peaceful, a poisonous snake,
having entered the mouth of a mongoose,
The mother of the green frog approves,

analyzed: yam mama khādanti mat śakā  vilumpatā iva purisaḥ
translated: that I am eaten by the frogs.”
“A man robs as long as he can get away with it,

analyzed: saḥ viluttaḥ vilumpati iti 🔽harita maṇḍūka jātakam navama
translated: then the robber is robbed.”🔽The Green Frog Jātaka (No. 9)
